Topic.Title: 288.84 is the line in the sand for clarity moving forward

Message.Msg: I think you will see an upward test again of the old highs. Right now the market seems to be in no man's land regarding amzn. Technically, its stuck in a range between its pivot point and support level (297 and 280). Until these levels are tested again, you will get nothing but chop. Long term trend line is still in good shape and obviously the short term trend is being tested with it being down since earnings. Too early to tell if its a long term trend change or just a correction before going higher. I'm not saying anything you don't already know. the 288.84 has offerred support in the last few days and i think if that breaks below, the short term trend of going lower will get stronger. Same on the upside, if the pivot point doesn't act as resistance, new highs will be made.

Message.Title: This Week's BIGGEST Percentage Gainer
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) currently $8.67 with a market cap of only $75.9mm, $22.37mm in cash, and an enterprise value of just $53.53mm was just awarded a major NASA contract that is disclosed on the government's FBO web site but hasn't been announced yet by CCUR! The stock could absolutely explode this week! CCUR's technology will be powering NASA's Space Launch System simulations to see how the SLS will perform in space! CCUR's 3Q GAAP EPS was up 175% and when CCUR reports 4Q results after the close on Tuesday, August 27th, CCUR's 4Q GAAP EPS is expected to be up 350%! CCUR soared 17% after 3Q results and could rally by a much larger percentage this week! CCUR currently trades with an enterprise value/revenue ratio of only 0.85 and an enterprise value/free cash flow ratio of only 9.56! CCUR pays a HUGE dividend yield of 5.53%, with its next quarterly cash dividend payment coming just two weeks after its 4Q results! CCUR's MediaHawk multi-screen CDN video delivery technology is revolutionizing the pay-TV industry by delivering on demand video content to tablets, smartphones, and Smart TVs! 2 of America's 3 largest cable TV operators Time Warner Cable (TWC) and Cox are now using CCUR's MediaHawk for multi-screen video delivery! In late March, CCUR signed a HUGE new multi-screen CDN deal with the largest UK cable TV operator Virgin Media to power their new Virgin TV Anywhere platform! CCUR will report their first ever revenues from Virgin Media in their 4Q results on Tuesday, which could allow CCUR to far surpass expectations! CCUR has the strongest looking chart on the NASDAQ! Between their new HUGE NASA contract, 4Q results coming Tuesday, and their next quarterly dividend coming in early September, CCUR is about to breakout big into double digits! Read CCUR's press release from Thursday about all of their new breakthrough technologies that the company will demo to the public mid-September!

Message.Title: AMNZ longs: Double your money on AMZN every year
Message.Msg: I just sold Sep 30th $265-$260 bull spreads for $1 per option. For every $500 at risk, maximum profit is $100. That's a hell of a profit for holding position 30 days. The chance that AMCZN will drop another 10% from here is less than 15%, so the chance that you'll take full profit is well over 85%. The only way for AMZN to drop 10% from here is if the whole market will tank 10% in the next 30 days. The only risk is the Syria conflict which may suck us in and things go terribly wrong. I post my trade at holystocks dodkom. My recent big gain is on NUGT , up 50% in two weeks. Many of my option positions gained over 1000%. Come and see my trade at HOLYSTOCKS dodkomm

Topic.Title: AMNZ longs: Double your money on AMZN every year

Message.Msg: Why not double your profit by also selling some Sept 300/305 call credit spreads? The probability of AMZN trading at 300 by Sept expiry is probably lower than it trading down to 265...plus it would partially hedge you against a steep drop. I think they call that a CONDOR.

Topic.Title: Black Berry

Message.Msg: GRPN customers / marketplace liquidity to OPEN. Open's reservationsystems could be generalized and brought to bear on large # of service business with semi fixed cost structure and "perishable" inventory that already use GRPN. Would allow for/enable yield management/optimization algorithms to create and capture more value IMHO. There may very well be better synergies elsewhere, but definitely not zero here...
